00020 #include "DepthImageLoader.h"

00022 namespace brics_3d {

00024 DepthImageLoader::DepthImageLoader() {
00025         image = NULL;
00026         video = NULL;
00027 }
00028 
00029 DepthImageLoader::~DepthImageLoader() {
00030         cvReleaseImage(&image);
00031         cvReleaseCapture(&video);
00032         if (image)
00033                 delete image;
00034         //if (video)
00035         //      delete video;
00036 }
00037 
00038 IplImage* DepthImageLoader::loadDepthImage(string filename) {
00039 
00040         /* load the image */
00041         image = cvLoadImage(filename.c_str(), CV_LOAD_IMAGE_GRAYSCALE);
00042 
00043         /* check for errors */
00044         if (image == NULL) {
00045                 cerr << "ERROR: Cannot load image file: " << filename << endl;
00046         }
00047 
00048         /* check if input image is only in gray scale */
00049         assert(image->nChannels == 1); //only brightness channel
00050         assert(image->depth == IPL_DEPTH_8U); // 8bit depth => uchar => range is 0-255
00051 
00052         return image;
00053 }
00054 
00055 IplImage* DepthImageLoader::loadDepthImageVideo(string filename) {
00056 
00057         /* initialize video stream */
00058         video = cvCaptureFromFile(filename.c_str());
00059     if(video==NULL) {
00060         cerr << "ERROR: Cannot open video file: " << filename << endl;
00061         cerr << "This error might occur if the code is running on a debian likes system with OpenCV installed from the repository. ";
00062         cerr << "Please download the source code of OpenCV, and make sure ffmpeg is supported when compiling it."  << endl;
00063         return NULL;
00064     }
00065 
00066     /* retrieve first image */
00067     image = cvQueryFrame(video);
00068 
00069     /* in case of non gray level videos */
00070     if (image->nChannels > 1) {
00071         cerr << "WARNING: video stream might contain RGB data!" << endl;
00072                 CvScalar pixel;
00073 
00074                 /* check if all channels are equal */
00075                 for (int row = 0; row < image->height; ++row) {
00076                         for (int col = 0; col < image->width; ++col) {
00077                                 pixel = cvGet2D(image, row, col);
00078                                 switch (image->nChannels) {
00079                                         case 2:
00080                                                 assert(pixel.val[0] == pixel.val[1]);
00081                                                 break;
00082                                         case 3:
00083                                                 assert((pixel.val[0] == pixel.val[1]) && (pixel.val[1] == pixel.val[2]));
00084                                                 break;
00085                                         case 4:
00086                                                 assert((pixel.val[0] == pixel.val[1]) && (pixel.val[1] == pixel.val[2]) && (pixel.val[2] == pixel.val[3]));
00087                                                 break;
00088                                         default:
00089                                                 cerr << "ERROR: video stream contains too many channels" << endl;
00090                                                         return NULL;
00091                                 }
00092                         }
00093                 }
00094                 cerr << "But all channels are equal (at least in the first frame). Treating this as gray value stream." << endl;
00095     }
00096         return image;
00097 }
00098 
00099 IplImage* DepthImageLoader::getDepthImage() {
00100 
00101         /* check if image is loaded */
00102         if (image == NULL) {
00103                 cerr << "WARNING: No image available. Please load one first one." << endl;
00104         }
00105 
00106         return image;
00107 }
00108 
00109 IplImage* DepthImageLoader::getNextDepthImage() {
00110 
00111         /* check if image and video are loaded */
00112         if (image == NULL || video == NULL) {
00113                 cerr << "WARNING: No video stream available. Please load one first one." << endl;
00114         }
00115 
00116     /* retrieve next image */
00117     image = cvQueryFrame(video);
00118 
00119     return image;
00120 }
00121 
00122 void DepthImageLoader::displayDepthImage() {
00123 
00124         /* check if image is loaded */
00125         if (image == NULL) {
00126                 cerr << "WARNING: No image available. Please load one first."
00127                                 << endl;
00128                 return;
00129         }
00130 
00131         /* create a window */
00132         cvNamedWindow("depthImage", CV_WINDOW_AUTOSIZE);
00133 
00134         /* display the image */
00135         cvShowImage("depthImage", image);
00136 
00137         /* wait until user press a key */
00138         cvWaitKey(0);
00139 
00140         /* free memory */
00141         cvDestroyWindow("depthImage");
00142 
00143 }
